creditline: Gift of Ruth and David Waterbury
description: extremely thin, delicate paper bowl with wasp paper on exterior affixed to thin white paper substrate; small flat base with widely-flaring sides
text: In the early 1990s Sekimachi, a groundbreaking fiber artist since the 1970s, began to form paper vessels, emphasizing translucency. She used as her templates the bowls her husband, wood turner Bob Stocksdale, made from exotic woods. Sekimachi’s single paper bowls, such as this one made from repurposed hornet’s nest paper, allow you to see the ephemeral form and material while perhaps imagining the original bowl.
title: Untitled
